      • isConstraintViolationException

        public static boolean isConstraintViolationException(Throwable throwable)
        Checks if the given exception has its cause in a database constraint violation, that can be a hint of concurrent access (e.g. creating the same user parallel). so maybe a rerun of the causing function helps. This method will check the provided Throwable and the causes up the chain.
        Parameters:
        throwable - the exception to check
        Returns:
        true if it is a constraint violation exception and a recall of the function may help

      • isConstraintViolationExceptionWithoutCause

        public static boolean isConstraintViolationExceptionWithoutCause(Throwable th)
        Checks if the given exception has is a database constraint violation, that can be a hint of concurrent access (e.g. creating the same user parallel). so maybe a rerun of the causing function helps. Remark: The determination of the violation exception is considering only the given one, not the cause. See isConstraintViolationException(Throwable)
        Parameters:
        th - the exception to check
        Returns:
        true if it is a constraint violation exception and a recall of the function may help
